themes: Rising cost of living displacing artists and venues
Inequitable access to funding and institutional support
Marginalization of grassroots and underrepresented creatives
Shortage of affordable, accessible, and safe venues
Artist burnout and instability due to lack of sustained support
key_phrases: The cost of living in Austin continues to rise, pushing out artists, musicians, and small venues
Many can’t afford studio space, rehearsal rooms, or even tickets
Access to funding, media attention, and institutional support often favors larger or more established organizations
leaving out grassroots initiatives especially those led by BIPOC, queer, disabled, and immigrant creatives
shortage of affordable, accessible, and safe venues
stifles hyperlocal cultural expression and disconnects artists from their own communities
artists operate without long-term stability or institutional backing
many burn out or leave Austin altogether
barriers_identified: Unaffordable studio space, rehearsal rooms, and tickets
Funding and support favoring larger organizations
Marginalization of BIPOC, queer, disabled, and immigrant creatives
Shortage of affordable, accessible, and safe venues
Lack of long-term stability or institutional backing
Artists forced to juggle multiple roles and side jobs
Artist burnout and exodus from Austin
